bibl.title: Report from Alexander N. Stark to the Adjutant General, June 4, 1900

div1.p: Stark reports cases of yellow fever.

div1.head: Report from Alexander N. Stark to the Adjutant General, June 4, 1900
div1.opener:
L. R.
1511
No.
Col. Bks
Havana, Cuba.
RECEIVED, JUN 3- Rec'd
NY 1714
June, 4, 1900
Surgeon, post
Reports on yellow fever.
POST HOSPITAL, COLUMBIA BARRACKS, CUBA,
JUNE 4, 1900.
To the
ADJUTANT,
Columbia Barracks, Cuba.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to inform you that George B. O'Cain, civilian
employee, #10 Corral, developed Yellow Fever June 3, 1900, and was
removed to Isolation Camp.
It is probable he contracted the disease in the corral.

Mrs Mary G. Sherwood, wife of 1st class Sergeant Sherwood, Sig-
nal Corps, deceased, developed Yellow Fever June 3, 1900, the disease
being most certainly contracted in #20, General Lee St.

Private E. A. Teeter, Hosp. Corps, Chief Surgeon's orderly, de-
veloped symptoms warranting his removal to Isolation Camp as a sus-
pect; his duties required him to be at #10 corral frequently during
the day.

Private Richard B Crane, “B”, 7th Cavalry, removed to Isolation
Camp this date as a suspect; point of infection undetermined.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, A. N. Stark Capt. and Asst. Surgeon, U. S. Army,
Surgeon.
1.8.1943.
